conbody.p: To configure a notification template, the following parameters are required.

entry.p: Parameter
Description
Mandatory/Optional

row.entry: Configure a unique name for the notification template. The name cannot exceed 50 characters.

entry.p: Priority of the notification to be sent.
Valid values:

li.p: High: High-priority notifications are sent directly, without considering the frequency logic.
Normal: Normal priority notifications are sent after considering the frequency logic.

entry.p: Default value: Normal

Note: If the incoming request contains a priority parameter and value, this value is given precedence. If priority is not specified in the incoming request, then the priority specified in the notification template is used to send the notification.

row.entry: If this check box is selected, the template cannot be deleted. The delete option does not appear for such templates in the list. To delete the template, you need to edit it first and clear this check box.

entry.p: The type of notification to be sent.
Valid values: EMAIL, SMS, SOAP, REST, KAFKA, TCP/IP, PUSH

This field provides an option to send the notification to multiple servers (from the list of available servers) for a selected channel. To specify multiple servers for a channel, click the Server IDs field and select the check boxes for the appropriate servers.
If no server is selected, the notification is sent using the default server defined in the application preferences (see ).
This field is not available for PUSH and KAFKA channels.
This field appears only for KAFKA channel.
Select one or more Kafka brokers to which the notification is to be sent.
The type of notification such as usage, offers, etc. This is chosen based on the preferences defined.
Valid values: Usage, Failures, Account Update, Offers, Threshold
The encoding such as UTF-8 used to send the message on the network.
Valid values: UTF-8, UTF-16, UTF-32
Note: For SMS, the valid values are: GSM7, UTF16[UTF_16BE], ASCII, ISO_8859_1. The default value is GSM7.

row.entry:
This parameter determines the set of users in the input group to whom notifications are sent. It can be defined in both group notification profile and notification channels. If it is defined for a channel, then the value from the channel is used. If it is not defined for a channel, then the value defined in group notification profile is used.
Valid values:
Group Selected Members: The notifications are sent to selected members specified in the incoming request.
Group Admin: The notifications are sent to only the group admin.
Group Admin and Selected Members: The notifications are sent to the group admin and selected members specified in the incoming request.
All Members and Group Admin: The notifications are sent to all group members including the group admin.
All Members except Group Admin: The notifications are sent to all group members in the group except for the group admin.
None: No notification is sent.
A receiver type can be defined for each channel. When multiple channels are defined in a template, the notification is sent to the selected receiver types for each channel.

entry.p: This parameter is used only for customized behavior. It is available only for TCP/IP channel.
Valid values:

li.p: DVS: The TCP/IP notification works in a round robin manner.
None: The TCP/IP notification works in a one-to-one manner.

entry.p: Define the language, subject and content for the template. To add another language, click ADD LANGUAGE.

row.entry: The language for the template. The list presents languages that are configured in the application preference Language.

entry.p: The subject of the notification. It is used only in case of email notifications. For other channels, this field is not used.
For email channels, if this parameter is left empty, the value set in the "DEFAULT_EMAIL_SUBJECT" parameter in the TPASystemConstants file is used.

Allows you to configure an appropriate notification message to the subscriber for usage management, balance and account thresholds, and other network events that can be sent using SMS, email, SOAP, or RESTful services.
You can also use the notification variables, to send specific information in your message.
